#Text=Egypt seals border with Gaza after 11 days
#Text=Sunday , February 3 , 2008
#Text=Egypt has closed the border with the Gaza Strip , ending 11 days of unrestricted movement for Palestinians .
#Text=Egyptian security forces used barbed wire and metal barricades to seal the last remaining gaps in the barricade along the border .
#Text=Egyptians who were in Gaza are being allowed to return home , and Palestinians on the Egyptian side of the border are still able to go back to Gaza .
#Text=But no new crossings are being permitted .
#Text=Hamas -affiliated militants on the Gaza side of the border have been turning people back and telling them it is closed .
#Text=There were reports of scuffles with Gazans who still wanted to cross into Egypt , but most reports said the situation remained fairly calm .
#Text=A senior Hamas leader in Gaza , Mahmoud Zahar , said Saturday there had been an agreement between Egypt and Hamas to control the border , and suggested that the closure might be temporary .
#Text=Egyptian officials have not commented on the existence of any deal with Hamas , but have repeatedly vowed to regain full control of the situation at the border .
#Text=Local resident Ibrahim Mohammed Ahmed owns a small grocery shop in Rafah .
#Text=He spoke to VOA by telephone from the nearby town of Sheikh Zuwayad .
#Text=He said the situation is tight and controlled now .
#Text=The government has closed the entire border in Rafah and all the roads .
#Text=Every 100 meters there is a checkpoint .
#Text=A Palestinian who crossed into Egypt to visit relatives , Essam Ibrahim Issa , spoke to VOA by phone from another small community near Rafah .
#Text=He said all the roads are blocked and Egyptian security forces are making Palestinians return to Gaza .
#Text=He said , They put them in trucks and take them back to Rafah .
#Text=Issa said Hamas has indicated that the border will re-open in about a week , and he is hoping for a new agreement that will let him cross into Egypt legally .
#Text=He said he would be heading home to Gaza later in the day , but once the border crossing is officially reopened , he wants to return to Egypt legally , allowing him freedom of movement .
#Text=The border closure ends 11 days of unrestricted movement across the Egypt-Gaza border .
#Text=Gunmen in Gaza blew open sections of the border barricade on January 23 , days after Israel began imposing a near-total blockade on the territory .
#Text=Hundreds of thousands of Palestinians crossed into Egypt to buy food and other supplies that had become scarce or expensive in Gaza .
#Text=Egyptian security forces set up a cordon around the border town of Rafah , trying to keep Palestinians from moving further into Egypt .
#Text=Egypt says at least 17 Palestinians have been arrested in Sinai carrying weapons and explosives since the crisis began .
#Text=The international community and the Fatah -led Palestinian Authority have objected to any border deal involving Hamas , which violently seized control of Gaza in June .
#Text=Egypt , however , views the open border as a serious security risk and has pressed Fatah to accept some kind of deal with Hamas in order to see that it remains under control .
